result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy Jerome Cameron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.


**Restitution is set at $0.**

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Roy Jerome Cameron in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Roy Jerome Cameron in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  To the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Statements by parties.
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete  Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at $0.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant in court on positive drug test. Justice point report received.  Atty Renden does not appear.  Court admonishes defendant and refers him back to Justicepoint.  Case remains calendared for 8-27-2015.

Defendant Roy Jerome Cameron in court with attorney Elizabeth Longo.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to branch 4 in trial, and defense requesting additional time to review plea forms with defendant, the Plea and Sentencing Hearing is adjourned to Branch 38 on 8-27-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Samantha C., make all appearances with Justice Point Supervision, absolute sobriety, no possession of dangerous weapons, and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  Victim was present and did not wish to make a statement.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers and no firearms or weapons.   mld

Defendant Roy Jerome Cameron in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-15-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
